SOCRATES SCHOLASTICUS (ca. 380–439): a lawyer and ecclesiastical historian in Constantinople. His seven-book Church History in Greek, a continuation of Eusebius’s chronicle, covers the period 305–439 (each book is equivalent to an eastern emperor’s reign). It emphasizes events in Constantinople and is noteworthy for its detail and use of documentary sources

title: SOZOMEN SCHOLASTICUS (fifth century): a lawyer and ecclesiastical historian, who was born near Gaza, but moved to Constantinople.
